column1: Yelizovo (Russian: Е́лизово) is a town in Kamchatka Krai
column3: located on the Avacha River 32 kilometers (20 mi) northwest of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky. Population: 39

column1: Founded in 1848 as the selo of Stary Ostrog (Ста́рый Остро́г)
column3: after the Russian admiral Vasily Zavoyko who led the defense of Petropavlovsk in 1854. The village was renamed Yelizovo in 1924. Urban-type settlement status was granted to it in 1964
column4: and town status was granted in 1975.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Yelizovo serves as the administrative center of Yelizovsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated as Yelizovo Town Under Krai Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Yelizovo Town Under Krai Jurisdiction is incorporated as Yelizovskoye Urban Settlement within Yelizovsky Municipal District.

column1: The town's most notable claim to fame is serving as the host for Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky Airport
column2: the largest airport on Kamchatka. A major Soviet space telemetry station
there is a long-wave broadcasting station with a 255 metres (837 ft) tall ARRT-Antenna.
